bioghist.p: Robert Aitken (1735-1802) was born in Scotland but from 1771 made Philadelphia his home. He was a printer, publisher, bookseller and engraver. His outstanding work was the "Aitken Bible," (1782), first complete English Bible printed in America. Also published "Aitken's General American Register," (1773), and "Pennsylvania Magazine", (1775-1776).

scopecontent.p: One volume, a ledger, is the least interesting, in that it is a brief record of accounts, in many cases incomplete, covering 1777-1802. However, the accounts do present a fascinating array of names, merchant houses, and even churches carrying accounts with Aitkin. The second volume, a waste book for 1771-1802, provides a record of Atikin's daily business.
